metadata.title: CVE-2024-36959 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:pinctrl: devicetree: fix refcount leak in pinctrl_dt_to_map() If we fail toallocate propname buffer, we need to drop the reference count we just took.Because the pinctrl_dt_free_maps() includes the droping operation, here wecall it directly.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36959` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
